title: Using `anxiety` dataset
text: Assuming want calculate average age separating results sex zone variables, can just one line code: reason syntax concise implicitly using data.table package allows us use DT[, j, ] syntax. information package, recommend reading documentation.
code: anxiety[, .(mean_age = mean(age)), .(sex, zone)] #>       sex zone mean_age #> 1: Female   CZ 30.46222 #> 2:   Male   CZ 33.11290 #> 3: Female   PZ 40.24034 #> 4:   Male   PZ 39.69072

title: Using `anxiety` dataset
text: visualise data package, recommend using ggplot2 library, offers whole range functions driven common principle, grammar graphs. get started can load using library() function, well additional packages might need. start , let’s create simple bar plot comparong mean age men women:  Nice! Now let’s add error bars representing error mean get better intuition difference:  Good, quite … Maybe add form shape can inform us distribution group. can try using boxplot end:  point costumize even adding geoms like violin dots even grouping variables enhance work. allow us generate informative graphic visually pleasing:  using layer-style plotting system, can create informative visualization can generate meaningfull insights data.
code: library(ggplot2)     # Main package for graphics library(ggside)      # For adding marginal distributions library(ggsci)       # For wider choices on colours  theme_set(new = theme_classic()) ggplot(anxiety, aes(y  = age, x = sex)) +   geom_bar(stat = "summary",             fun = "mean") ggplot(anxiety, aes(y  = age, x = sex)) +   geom_bar(stat = "summary",             fun = "mean") +   geom_errorbar(stat = "summary",                 fun.data = "mean_se",                  width = .5) ggplot(anxiety, aes(y  = age, fill = sex)) +   geom_boxplot() ggplot(anxiety, aes(y  = age, x = sex, fill = zone)) +   facet_grid(cols = vars(zone)) +   geom_violin(alpha = 0.3) +   geom_boxplot(width = 0.1, outlier.shape = NA) +   geom_jitter(cex = 1, width = .1, alpha = 0.2) +   labs(fill = "Confinement zone", x = "Sex", y = "Age (years old)",        title = "Age by Sex and Confinement Zone",        subtitle = "Violin and box plots showing the observed age distribution per group",        caption = "CZ = Confinement zone\nPZ = Partial confinement zone")

text: Caren Alvarado Aravena. Author. Matías Castillo Aguilar. Author, maintainer. Cristian Núñez Espinosa. Author.

text: Alvarado Aravena C, Castillo Aguilar M, Núñez Espinosa C (2022). AnxietySleep: Sleep Quality Anxiety Confinement. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/NIM-ACh/AnxietySleep.
code: @Manual{,   title = {AnxietySleep: Sleep Quality and Anxiety in Confinement},   author = {Caren {Alvarado Aravena} and Matías {Castillo Aguilar} and Cristian {Núñez Espinosa}},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/NIM-ACh/AnxietySleep}, }

what: Sleep Quality and Anxiety in Confinement
title: Sleep Quality and Anxiety in Confinement
text: R package contains data facilitate exploration reproducibility analyses carried study Anxiety Confinement conducted Caren Alvarado-Aravena, Matías Castillo-Aguilar Cristian Núñez-Espinosa.

title: Sleep Quality and Anxiety in Confinement
text: R high-level statistical programming language used data analysis, well development software tools web sites, reports, applications, digital books, etc. information can visit R-project website.

title: Sleep Quality and Anxiety in Confinement
text: install development version package, can type R console following:

title: Anxiety & Confinement — AnxietySleep-package
text: Data anxiety confinement study Alvarado et al. (2022) <doi: 10.3390/bs12100398>.

title: Anxiety & Confinement — AnxietySleep-package
text: Maintainer: Matías Castillo Aguilar matcasti@umag.cl (ORCID) Authors: Caren Alvarado Aravena caren.ccaa@gmail.com (ORCID) Cristian Núñez Espinosa cristian.nunez@umag.cl (ORCID)

what: Data from the anxiety and confinement study. — anxiety
title: Data from the anxiety and confinement study. — anxiety
text: dataset contains variables used anxiety confinement study carried Alvarado-Aravena et al. 2022.

title: Data from the anxiety and confinement study. — anxiety
Data from the anxiety and confinement study. — anxiety
text: data frame 617 rows y 7 variables: id: Factor. identification code subject. sex: Factor w/ 2 levels "Female", "Male". Sex participants. zone: Factor w/ 2 levels "CZ", "UZ". Zone subject time answering questionnaire, either CZ (Confinement Zone) UZ (Unconfinement Zone). beck_global: Integer. Global score Beck Anxiety Inventory. pits_global: Integer. Global score Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index. age: Integer. Age subjects years. cat_age: Factor w/ 4 levels "18-25", "26-40", "41-50", ">50". Age subjects years.

title: Data from the anxiety and confinement study. — anxiety
text: Alvarado-Aravena, C., Arriaza, K., Castillo-Aguilar, M., Flores, K., Dagnino-Subiabre, ., Estrada-Goic, C., & Núñez-Espinosa, C. (2022). Effect Confinement Anxiety Symptoms Sleep Quality COVID-19 Pandemic. Behavioral Sciences, 12(10), 398.

title: Data from the anxiety and confinement study. — anxiety
code: # Mean age grouped by sex and zone using `data.table` syntax anxiety[,  # No filtering (i)         list(mean_age = mean(age)), # Action to do (j)         list(sex, zone)] # Grouping vars (by) #>       sex zone mean_age #> 1: Female   CZ 30.46222 #> 2:   Male   CZ 33.11290 #> 3: Female   PZ 40.24034 #> 4:   Male   PZ 39.69072  # Mean PSQI score grouped by sex and zone, for those with # an age greater than 18 AND a Beck score greater than 10. anxiety[age > 18 & beck_global > 10,         list(mean_psqi = mean(pits_global)),         list(sex, zone)] #>       sex zone mean_psqi #> 1: Female   CZ  10.66346 #> 2:   Male   CZ  12.00000 #> 3:   Male   PZ  10.00000 #> 4: Female   PZ  12.00000

title: AnxietySleep 0.0.0.9000
